info.title: LangSmith Deployment Control Plane API
info.description:
The LangSmith Deployment Control Plane API is used to programmatically create and manage
Agent Server deployments. For example, the APIs can be orchestrated to
create custom CI/CD workflows.

## Host
https://api.host.langchain.com

## Authentication
To authenticate with the LangSmith Deployment Control Plane API, set the `X-Api-Key` header
to a valid [LangSmith API key](https://docs.langchain.com/langsmith/create-account-api-key#create-an-api-key).

## Versioning
Each endpoint path is prefixed with a version (e.g. `v1`, `v2`).

## Quick Start
1. Call `POST /v2/deployments` to create a new Deployment. The response body contains the Deployment ID (`id`) and the ID of the latest (and first) revision (`latest_revision_id`).
1. Call `GET /v2/deployments/{deployment_id}` to retrieve the Deployment. Set `deployment_id` in the URL to the value of Deployment ID (`id`).
1. Poll for revision `status` until `status` is `DEPLOYED` by calling `GET /v2/deployments/{deployment_id}/revisions/{latest_revision_id}`.
1. Call `PATCH /v2/deployments/{deployment_id}` to update the deployment.

post.description:
Create a listener.

Creating a listener is only allowed for LangSmith organizations with self-hosted enterprise plans.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the container. Must be a DNS_LABEL.

imagePullPolicy.title: Imagepullpolicy
imagePullPolicy.description: Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent.

command.title: Command
command.description: Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell.

env.title: Env
env.description: List of environment variables to set in the container.

envFrom.title: Envfrom
envFrom.description: List of sources to populate environment variables in the container.

volumeMounts.title: Volumemounts
volumeMounts.description: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem.

securityContext.title: Securitycontext
securityContext.description: Security options the pod should run with.

restartPolicy.title: Restartpolicy
restartPolicy.description: RestartPolicy for the container (for sidecar containers). One of Always, OnFailure.

Container.title: Container
Container.description: Container specification for init and sidecar containers.

name.title: Name
name.description:
Name of the deployment.

A LangSmith tracing project with the same name will also automatically be created. This cannot be changed once the deployment is created.

source.title: Source
source.description:
Deploy from a GitHub repository (`github`) or a Docker image (`external_docker`).

Deploying from GitHub is only available for Cloud SaaS deployments. Deploying from a Docker image is only available for self-hosted deployments. This cannot be changed once the deployment is created.

id.title: ID
id.description:
The ID of the deployment.

This is a read-only field.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description:
The creation time of the deployment.

This is a read-only field.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description:
The last update time of the deployment.

This is a read-only field.

status.title: Status
status.description:
The status of the deployment.

This is a read-only field.

latest_revision_id.title: Latest Revision ID
latest_revision_id.description:
The ID of the latest revision of the deployment.

This is a read-only field.

active_revision_id.title: Active Revision ID
active_revision_id.description:
The ID of the current (actively deployed) revision of the deployment.

This is a read-only field.

name.title: Name
name.description:
Name of the deployment.

A LangSmith tracing project with the same name will also automatically be created. This cannot be changed once the deployment is created.

source.title: Source
source.description:
Deploy from a GitHub repository (`github`) or a Docker image (`external_docker`).

Deploying from GitHub is only available for Cloud SaaS deployments. Deploying from a Docker image is only available for self-hosted deployments. This cannot be changed once the deployment is created.

DeploymentCreateRequest.title: DeploymentCreateRequest
DeploymentCreateRequest.description: Request body for creating a deployment.

DeploymentPatchRequest.title: DeploymentPatchRequest
DeploymentPatchRequest.description:
Request body for patching a deployment.

Patching a deployment may trigger a new revision depending on the provided `source` configurations.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Pagination offset. Pass this value to subsequent requests to fetch the next page.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the environment variable. Must be a C_IDENTIFIER.

value.title: Value
value.description: Variable value. Defaults to empty string.

valueFrom.title: Valuefrom
valueFrom.description: Source for the environment variable's value. Cannot be used if value is not empty.

id.title: ID
id.description:
GitHub Integration ID.

For example, in the `POST /v2/deployments` request body, set `integration_id` to the value of this field.

host_integration_id.title: GitHub Integration ID
host_integration_id.description:
GitHub Integration ID.

For example, in the `POST /v2/deployments` request body, set `integration_id` to the value of this field.

url.title: URL
url.description:
GitHub repository URL.

For example, in the `POST /v2/deployments` request body, set `source_config.repo_url` to the value of this field.

default_branch.title: Default Branch
default_branch.description:
GitHub repository default branch.

For example, in the `POST /v2/deployments` request body, set `source_revision_config.repo_ref` to the value of this field.

compute_type.title: Compute Type
compute_type.description:
The compute type of the listener.

This cannot be changed (`PUT`) once the listener is created.

compute_id.title: Compute Id
compute_id.description:
User assigned unique ID of the compute infrastructure for the listener.

For example, if `compute_type` is `k8s`, then the user may set this field to the Kubernetes cluster name. This cannot be changed (`PUT`) once the listener is created.

id.title: ID
id.description:
System assigned ID of the listener.

This is a read-only field.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description:
The creation time of the listener.

This is a read-only field.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description:
The last update time of the listener.

This is a read-only field.

k8s_namespaces.title: Kubernetes Namespaces
k8s_namespaces.description:
A list of Kubernetes namespaces to which the listener is configured for.

Only applicable for `k8s` compute type.

ListenerComputeConfig.title: ListenerComputeConfig
ListenerComputeConfig.description:
Fields for a listener that are specific to `compute_type`.

All fields are nullable, but are validated based on `compute_type`.

k8s_namespace.title: K8S Namespace
k8s_namespace.description:
Kubernetes namespace where the deployment will be deployed to.

This cannot be changed (`PATCH`) once the deployment is created. Only applicable for deployments of listeners with `k8s` compute type.

ListenerConfig.title: ListenerConfig
ListenerConfig.description:
Listener configuration for the deployment.

All fields are nullable, but are validated based on `compute_type` of the listener ID. Only applicable for `external_docker` source.

compute_type.title: Compute Type
compute_type.description:
The compute type of the listener.

This cannot be changed (`PUT`) once the listener is created.

compute_id.title: Compute Id
compute_id.description:
User assigned unique ID of the compute infrastructure for the listener.

For example, if `compute_type` is `k8s`, then the user may set this field to the Kubernetes cluster name. This cannot be changed (`PUT`) once the listener is created.

ListenerCreateRequest.title: ListenerCreateRequest
ListenerCreateRequest.description:
Request body for creating a listener.

A listener must have a unique combination of `workspace_id` and `compute_id`.

ListenerPatchRequest.title: ListenerPatchRequest
ListenerPatchRequest.description: Requst body for patching a listener.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Pagination offset. Pass this value to subsequent requests to fetch the next page.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the referent (e.g., name of a Secret for imagePullSecrets).

LocalObjectReference.title: LocalObjectReference
LocalObjectReference.description: Reference to an object in the same namespace.

OAuthProviderCreateRequest.title: OAuthProviderCreateRequest
OAuthProviderCreateRequest.description: Request model for creating OAuth provider.

OAuthProviderUpdateRequest.title: OAuthProviderUpdateRequest
OAuthProviderUpdateRequest.description: Request model for updating OAuth provider.

limits.title: Limits
limits.description: Limits describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed.

requests.title: Requests
requests.description: Requests describes the minimum amount of compute resources required.

min_scale.title: Min Scale
min_scale.description: The minimum scale (number of replicas) of the deployment.

max_scale.title: Max Scale
max_scale.description: The maximum scale (number of replicas) of the deployment.

cpu.title: CPU
cpu.description: CPU request of a single replica of the deployment. If cpu_limit is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

cpu_limit.title: CPU Limit
cpu_limit.description: CPU limit of a single replica of the deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x cpu.

memory_mb.title: Memory (MB)
memory_mb.description: Memory request (MB) of a single replica of the deployment. If memory_limit_mb is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

memory_limit_mb.title: Memory Limit (MB)
memory_limit_mb.description: Memory limit (MB) of a single replica of the deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x memory_mb.

queue_min_scale.title: Queue Min Scale
queue_min_scale.description: The minimum scale (number of replicas) of the queue deployment. If not provided, defaults to the same value as `min_scale`.

queue_max_scale.title: Queue Max Scale
queue_max_scale.description: The maximum scale (number of replicas) of the queue deployment. If not provided, defaults to the same value as `max_scale`.

queue_cpu.title: Queue CPU
queue_cpu.description: CPU request of a single replica of the queue deployment. If not provided, defaults to the same value as `cpu`. If queue_cpu_limit is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

queue_cpu_limit.title: Queue CPU Limit
queue_cpu_limit.description: CPU limit of a single replica of the queue deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x queue_cpu.

queue_memory_mb.title: Queue Memory (MB)
queue_memory_mb.description: Memory request (MB) of a single replica of the queue deployment. If not provided, defaults to the same value as `memory_mb`. If queue_memory_limit_mb is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

queue_memory_limit_mb.title: Queue Memory Limit (MB)
queue_memory_limit_mb.description: Memory limit (MB) of a single replica of the queue deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x queue_memory_mb.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Additional labels to apply to resources created for the deployment.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: Additional annotations to apply to resources created for the deployment.

service_account_name.title: Service Account Name
service_account_name.description:
The name of the service account to use for the deployment.

This must already exist in the Kubernetes namespace where the deployment will be deployed to.

image_pull_secrets.title: Image Pull Secrets
image_pull_secrets.description: List of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling container images. Each entry is a LocalObjectReference to a Secret of type kubernetes.io/dockerconfigjson.

volumes.title: Volumes
volumes.description: List of volumes that can be mounted by containers belonging to the pod. Reference the kubernetes documentation for more details on how to configure volumes.

volume_mounts.title: Volume Mounts
volume_mounts.description: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem. Reference the kubernetes documentation for more details on how to configure volume mounts.

init_containers.title: Init Containers
init_containers.description: List of initialization containers belonging to the pod. Init containers are set as initContainers in the pod spec and run to completion before the main application container starts.

sidecars.title: Sidecars
sidecars.description: List of sidecar containers that run alongside the main application container. These will be added to the pod spec as additional containers.

db_cpu.title: Database CPU
db_cpu.description: CPU request of the Postgres database deployment. If db_cpu_limit is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

db_cpu_limit.title: Database CPU Limit
db_cpu_limit.description: CPU limit of the Postgres database deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x db_cpu.

db_memory_mb.title: Database Memory (MB)
db_memory_mb.description: Memory request (MB) of the Postgres database deployment. If db_memory_limit_mb is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

db_memory_limit_mb.title: Database Memory Limit (MB)
db_memory_limit_mb.description: Memory limit (MB) of the Postgres database deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x db_memory_mb.

db_storage_gi.title: Database Storage (GiB)
db_storage_gi.description: Storage (GiB) of the Postgres database deployment.

db_max_connections.title: Database Max Connections
db_max_connections.description: Maximum number of connections allowed to the Postgres database.

ResourceSpec-Input.title: ResourceSpec
ResourceSpec-Input.description:
Resource specification for the deployment.

When updating a deployment (`PATCH`), setting this field to a non-null value will trigger creation of a new revision and overwrite the existing resource_spec for the deployment. Only applicable for `external_docker` source.

min_scale.title: Min Scale
min_scale.description: The minimum scale (number of replicas) of the deployment.

max_scale.title: Max Scale
max_scale.description: The maximum scale (number of replicas) of the deployment.

cpu.title: CPU
cpu.description: CPU request of a single replica of the deployment. If cpu_limit is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

cpu_limit.title: CPU Limit
cpu_limit.description: CPU limit of a single replica of the deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x cpu.

memory_mb.title: Memory (MB)
memory_mb.description: Memory request (MB) of a single replica of the deployment. If memory_limit_mb is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

memory_limit_mb.title: Memory Limit (MB)
memory_limit_mb.description: Memory limit (MB) of a single replica of the deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x memory_mb.

queue_min_scale.title: Queue Min Scale
queue_min_scale.description: The minimum scale (number of replicas) of the queue deployment. If not provided, defaults to the same value as `min_scale`.

queue_max_scale.title: Queue Max Scale
queue_max_scale.description: The maximum scale (number of replicas) of the queue deployment. If not provided, defaults to the same value as `max_scale`.

queue_cpu.title: Queue CPU
queue_cpu.description: CPU request of a single replica of the queue deployment. If not provided, defaults to the same value as `cpu`. If queue_cpu_limit is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

queue_cpu_limit.title: Queue CPU Limit
queue_cpu_limit.description: CPU limit of a single replica of the queue deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x queue_cpu.

queue_memory_mb.title: Queue Memory (MB)
queue_memory_mb.description: Memory request (MB) of a single replica of the queue deployment. If not provided, defaults to the same value as `memory_mb`. If queue_memory_limit_mb is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

queue_memory_limit_mb.title: Queue Memory Limit (MB)
queue_memory_limit_mb.description: Memory limit (MB) of a single replica of the queue deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x queue_memory_mb.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Additional labels to apply to resources created for the deployment.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: Additional annotations to apply to resources created for the deployment.

service_account_name.title: Service Account Name
service_account_name.description:
The name of the service account to use for the deployment.

This must already exist in the Kubernetes namespace where the deployment will be deployed to.

image_pull_secrets.title: Image Pull Secrets
image_pull_secrets.description: List of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling container images. Each entry is a LocalObjectReference to a Secret of type kubernetes.io/dockerconfigjson.

volumes.title: Volumes
volumes.description: List of volumes that can be mounted by containers belonging to the pod. Reference the kubernetes documentation for more details on how to configure volumes.

volume_mounts.title: Volume Mounts
volume_mounts.description: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem. Reference the kubernetes documentation for more details on how to configure volume mounts.

init_containers.title: Init Containers
init_containers.description: List of initialization containers belonging to the pod. Init containers are set as initContainers in the pod spec and run to completion before the main application container starts.

sidecars.title: Sidecars
sidecars.description: List of sidecar containers that run alongside the main application container. These will be added to the pod spec as additional containers.

db_cpu.title: Database CPU
db_cpu.description: CPU request of the Postgres database deployment. If db_cpu_limit is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

db_cpu_limit.title: Database CPU Limit
db_cpu_limit.description: CPU limit of the Postgres database deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x db_cpu.

db_memory_mb.title: Database Memory (MB)
db_memory_mb.description: Memory request (MB) of the Postgres database deployment. If db_memory_limit_mb is not set, limit defaults to 2x this value.

db_memory_limit_mb.title: Database Memory Limit (MB)
db_memory_limit_mb.description: Memory limit (MB) of the Postgres database deployment. If not set, defaults to 2x db_memory_mb.

db_storage_gi.title: Database Storage (GiB)
db_storage_gi.description: Storage (GiB) of the Postgres database deployment.

db_max_connections.title: Database Max Connections
db_max_connections.description: Maximum number of connections allowed to the Postgres database.

ResourceSpec-Output.title: ResourceSpec
ResourceSpec-Output.description:
Resource specification for the deployment.

When updating a deployment (`PATCH`), setting this field to a non-null value will trigger creation of a new revision and overwrite the existing resource_spec for the deployment. Only applicable for `external_docker` source.

id.title: ID
id.description:
The ID of the revision.

This is a read-only field.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description:
The creation time of the revision.

This is a read-only field.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description:
The last update time of the revision.

This is a read-only field.

status.title: Status
status.description:
The status of the revision.

This is a read-only field.

source.title: Source
source.description:
Deploy from a GitHub repository (`github`) or a Docker image (`external_docker`).

Deploying from GitHub is only available for Cloud SaaS deployments. Deploying from a Docker image is only available for self-hosted deployments. This cannot be changed once the deployment is created.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Pagination offset. Pass this value to subsequent requests to fetch the next page.

Secret.title: Secret
Secret.description:
Secret for a deployment.

Secrets are accessible as environment variables in the deployment's container. In addition to user-defined secrets, Agent Server supports [pre-defined environment variables](https://langchain-ai.github.io/langgraph/cloud/reference/env_var/) that can be configured to augment the functionality of a deployment. When updating a deployment (`PATCH`), setting this field to a non-null value will trigger creation of a new revision.

integration_id.title: Integration ID
integration_id.description:
The ID of the integration used for the deployment.

Retrieve this value from the `GET /v1/integrations/github/install` endpoint. This cannot be changed (`PATCH`) once the deployment is created. Only applicable for `github` source.

repo_url.title: Repository URL
repo_url.description:
The URL of the git repository used for the deployment.

This cannot be changed (`PATCH`) once the deployment is created. Only applicable for `github` source.

deployment_type.title: Deployment Type
deployment_type.description:
The type of deployment to create.

See [Deployment Types](https://langchain-ai.github.io/langgraph/concepts/langgraph_control_plane/#deployment-types) for more details. This cannot be changed (`PATCH`) once the deployment is created. Only applicable for `github` source.

build_on_push.title: Build On Push
build_on_push.description:
Whether to build a new revision for the deployment on push to the `source_revision_config.repo_ref` (e.g. git branch).

Cannot be enabled when `source_revision_config.repo_ref` specifies a tag (starts with `refs/tags/`). Tags are immutable and cannot trigger automatic builds on push.

Only applicable for `github` source.

custom_url.title: Custom URL
custom_url.description:
The custom URL of the deployment.

This field can only be set for `external_docker` source deployments. However, it will be set automatically for `github` source deployments (read only).

listener_id.title: Listener ID
listener_id.description:
The ID of the listener used for the deployment.

Retrieve this value from the `GET /v2/listeners` endpoint. This cannot be changed (`PATCH`) once the deployment is created. Only applicable for `external_docker` source.

install_command.title: Install Command
install_command.description: The custom install command to run for your deployment. This only applies to JS deployments. This command will be run from the root of your repository - NOT where your langgraph.json file lives (unless these are the same place). If not provided, we will autodetect the command based on the presence of yarn/npm/etc. files.

build_command.title: Build Command
build_command.description: The custom build command to run for your deployment. This only applies to JS deployments. This command will be run from where your langgraph.json file lives. This is helpful for using shared workspaces in your deployments, without having to provide a postinstall command or something similar in your package.json.

integration_id.title: Integration ID
integration_id.description:
The ID of the integration used for the deployment.

Retrieve this value from the `GET /v1/integrations/github/install` endpoint. This cannot be changed (`PATCH`) once the deployment is created. Only applicable for `github` source.

repo_url.title: Repository URL
repo_url.description:
The URL of the git repository used for the deployment.

This cannot be changed (`PATCH`) once the deployment is created. Only applicable for `github` source.

deployment_type.title: Deployment Type
deployment_type.description:
The type of deployment to create.

See [Deployment Types](https://langchain-ai.github.io/langgraph/concepts/langgraph_control_plane/#deployment-types) for more details. This cannot be changed (`PATCH`) once the deployment is created. Only applicable for `github` source.

build_on_push.title: Build On Push
build_on_push.description:
Whether to build a new revision for the deployment on push to the `source_revision_config.repo_ref` (e.g. git branch).

Cannot be enabled when `source_revision_config.repo_ref` specifies a tag (starts with `refs/tags/`). Tags are immutable and cannot trigger automatic builds on push.

Only applicable for `github` source.

custom_url.title: Custom URL
custom_url.description:
The custom URL of the deployment.

This field can only be set for `external_docker` source deployments. However, it will be set automatically for `github` source deployments (read only).

listener_id.title: Listener ID
listener_id.description:
The ID of the listener used for the deployment.

Retrieve this value from the `GET /v2/listeners` endpoint. This cannot be changed (`PATCH`) once the deployment is created. Only applicable for `external_docker` source.

install_command.title: Install Command
install_command.description: The custom install command to run for your deployment. This only applies to JS deployments. This command will be run from the root of your repository - NOT where your langgraph.json file lives (unless these are the same place). If not provided, we will autodetect the command based on the presence of yarn/npm/etc. files.

build_command.title: Build Command
build_command.description: The custom build command to run for your deployment. This only applies to JS deployments. This command will be run from where your langgraph.json file lives. This is helpful for using shared workspaces in your deployments, without having to provide a postinstall command or something similar in your package.json.

SourceConfigRequest.title: SourceConfigRequest
SourceConfigRequest.description:
Fields for a deployment that are specific to the `source`, but do not require a new revision when modified or cannot be modified.

All fields are nullable, but are validated based on the `source`.

repo_ref.title: Repo Ref
repo_ref.description:
The git ref of the repository used for the deployment.

Supports:
- **Branches**: Specify just the branch name (e.g., `main`, `develop`)
- **Tags**: Specify the full ref path (e.g., `refs/tags/v1.0.0`)

When using a tag, `source_config.build_on_push` must be set to `false` since tags are immutable.

When updating a deployment (`PATCH`), setting this field to a non-null value will trigger creation of a new revision. Only applicable for `github` source.

langgraph_config_path.title: LangGraph Configuration Path
langgraph_config_path.description:
The path to the LangGraph configuration file (`langgraph.json`) used for the deployment.

When updating a deployment (`PATCH`), setting this field to a non-null value will trigger creation of a new revision. Only applicable for `github` source.

image_uri.title: Image URI
image_uri.description:
The URI of the Docker image used for the deployment.

When updating a deployment (`PATCH`), setting this field to a non-null value will trigger creation of a new revision. Only applicable for `external_docker` source.

repo_commit_sha.title: Repo commit SHA
repo_commit_sha.description:
The commit SHA of the git repository used for the deployment.

This is a read-only field. Only applicable for `github` source.

SourceRevisionConfig.title: SourceRevisionConfig
SourceRevisionConfig.description:
Source revision configuration.

For a `Deployment` resource, the field values refer to the latest revision of the `Deployment`. For a `Revision` resource, the field values refer to the `Revision` itself.

repo_ref.title: Repo Ref
repo_ref.description:
The git ref of the repository used for the deployment.

Supports:
- **Branches**: Specify just the branch name (e.g., `main`, `develop`)
- **Tags**: Specify the full ref path (e.g., `refs/tags/v1.0.0`)

When using a tag, `source_config.build_on_push` must be set to `false` since tags are immutable.

When updating a deployment (`PATCH`), setting this field to a non-null value will trigger creation of a new revision. Only applicable for `github` source.

langgraph_config_path.title: LangGraph Configuration Path
langgraph_config_path.description:
The path to the LangGraph configuration file (`langgraph.json`) used for the deployment.

When updating a deployment (`PATCH`), setting this field to a non-null value will trigger creation of a new revision. Only applicable for `github` source.

image_uri.title: Image URI
image_uri.description:
The URI of the Docker image used for the deployment.

When updating a deployment (`PATCH`), setting this field to a non-null value will trigger creation of a new revision. Only applicable for `external_docker` source.

SourceRevisionConfigRequest.title: SourceRevisionConfigRequest
SourceRevisionConfigRequest.description:
Fields for a deployment that are specific to the `source` and require a new revision when modified.

All fields are nullable, but are validated based on the `source`.

name.title: Name
name.description: Volume's name. Must be a DNS_LABEL and unique within the pod.

configMap.title: Configmap
configMap.description: ConfigMap represents a configMap that should populate this volume.

secret.title: Secret
secret.description: Secret represents a secret that should populate this volume.

emptyDir.title: Emptydir
emptyDir.description: EmptyDir represents a temporary directory that shares a pod's lifetime.

persistentVolumeClaim.title: Persistentvolumeclaim
persistentVolumeClaim.description: PersistentVolumeClaim represents a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim.

nfs.title: Nfs
nfs.description: NFS represents an NFS mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime.

projected.title: Projected
projected.description: Projected represents a volume that projects several volume sources into the same directory.

downwardAPI.title: Downwardapi
downwardAPI.description: DownwardAPI represents downward API about the pod that should populate this volume.

csi.title: Csi
csi.description: CSI represents a volume that should be handled by an external CSI driver.

name.title: Name
name.description: This must match the Name of a Volume.

mountPath.title: Mountpath
mountPath.description: Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted.

subPath.title: Subpath
subPath.description: Path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted.

mountPropagation.title: Mountpropagation
mountPropagation.description: Determines how mounts are propagated from the host to container and the other way around.

readOnly.title: Readonly
readOnly.description: Mounted read-only if true, read-write otherwise.

subPathExpr.title: Subpathexpr
subPathExpr.description: Expanded path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted.
